At just ten years old, Japan's Kyuta Kumagai is already a world champion sumo wrestler.
...eats as much as 4,000 calories a day and beats boys five and six years older than him.
Kumagai trains six days a week at a local temple lifting weights...
It often leaves him breathless, bloody and crying.
His dad, Taisuke, entered his son in his first tournament...
Taisuke Kumagai moved his family to a part of Tokyo famous for producing sumo wrestlers.
Now, Kyuta trains with former professional sumo wrestler Shinichi Taira.
